intro: Racosperma filifolium, commonly known as the silky acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are thin and silky to the touch, giving it its common name. Racosperma filifolium is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
